metadata.title: Home Is Where the Heart Is

lines.name: MATT

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: unexpected end, you look as the clay element of the tub that Nott had been placed upon has shattered and scattered across the room, the magic itself suddenly flaring out, the sigil that marked the ritual going cold, and all of you look down to see Nott there, sitting atop the broken sections of hardened clay, a goblin as she's always been since you met her.

lines.text: It was-- it was-- It wasn't terribly far, but I-- it was a wooded area at the base or in some mountains, a wooded, mountainous area.

lines.name: TRAVIS

lines.text: So are we back at the Xhorhaus yet?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Yes, oh, here we are at the Xhorhaus.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Let's make sure we don't come in contact with any synthetic fabrics.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I think, in this instance, we should definitely focus on Beau, because she's in way worse shape than I am.

lines.text: No, no, wait, that's not, no.

lines.text: What is that? What do you have? What do you have for her?

lines.text: My dad said he made a deal with a woman, in the woods, like, an old fortune teller woman.

lines.text: Did he say she had a weird laugh, or that she was in robes and she did something with goblins?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He was just a poor asshole street urchin who was in love with this lady of the town.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's-- he built his entire fucking life around this fortune teller, around a fucking tarot deck, basically.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: But did it work, is he rich? Is he married to your mom?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Did he say how he found her? Like how, who--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Did she talk about debts or something?

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Also, you two live very far away from each other.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Many fairy tales with an old crone in the woods.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You're up here, right? Where are you, Beau?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Yeah, but if she lives in the mountains or something, maybe Beau's--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Yeah, they're only like four inches from each other.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What is that, what does that mean?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Mount Mentiri actually is right in this region.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Is that where he met this woman?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He said he walked on foot, he heard about some woman who could trade.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: She had a home in the woods, in the mountains?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: She had a home in the woods, and he just walked barefoot until he eventually found her.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm setting up a little circle.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: she told him that he would be successful, and that he would have a successful winery, and that he would marry the woman he loved, and that he would birth a young beau to inherit the family business.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And he took it so literally that he named me Beau.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Wow, your dad is super superstitious.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He always gave me good luck trinkets.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Are you sure it's just a good luck trinket?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's just a piece-- it's just a jade necklace.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: I feel like, okay-- you know, it's been a rough day, but in the last six hours we've learned that Caduceus and Fjord are brothers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Maybe we should all just say everything that's ever happened to us--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Why didn't you hear it before?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It sounded vague enough, I don't know.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can you ask your father what this woman looked like?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Or where she was found, or-- can you send him a message? You connected--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Okay, okay, okay, What if I send him a message, I pretend to be the old woman--

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Didn't you do that once already?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I didn't know who I was pretending to be, but this time, I will pretend to be the old woman.

lines.name: SAM

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What's my name and where do I live?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Time begins to accelerate, but slow to a crawl simultaneously, and you feel the warm, familiar presence of your protector.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does the woman who cursed Nott live?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The breeze comes cold and biting, not in a way to deny it, but in a way that shivers the truth through you.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Has this creature ever had a conversation with Beau's father?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The cold breeze rescinds, and then, blows with equal strength.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Was that a yes or a no?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Does my family wait for me at the Menagerie?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We need to go see your father.

lines.text: What do you mean, you regret your weakness?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We need to talk to your father.

lines.text: Oh yeah, but if we talk to your dad, we don't have to go see the goblins.

lines.text: When was the last time that you saw your dad?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The night he slapped me across the face as I was getting drug out by the monks.

lines.text: He slapped you as you were leaving?

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I really don't like your dad.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I don't know, that didn't sound too complicated.

lines.name: SAM

lines.text: It's kind of close to Rexxentrum.

lines.text: How would we not go there in person?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Can we just send a message or--?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: If we're going to go find her, we got to go there anyway.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, I don't know if this is a conversation I want to have in 25 words.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: You want to just show up at the doorstep?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He threw me off the doorstep so why can't I just fucking show up?

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: He'd have a hard time throwing you off the doorstep again at this point.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We could throw him off the doorstep, and slap him across the face, right as we do it.

lines.name: SAM

lines.text: There is a staircase that goes to a second landing that wraps around the main foyer area, and there is a iron chandelier that sits in the middle that is circular with magically-held candles that just keep a constant, nice glow there.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: She goes and leaves into another room, and here's--

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I go over to the fireplace.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's warm, the hearth is burning.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Your family has done all right for themselves.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How you are-- how are you doing?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You can see, she is leaning in a very startled way, just looking directly down at Beau.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm sorry, I didn't know you were coming."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Yeah, it's kind of a trend that I have going on.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Gives a somewhat warm, somewhat stilted hug, and then pulls back a bit.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's important, and then we'll be gone, and you don't have to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I-- who are your friends here?" And you hear a voice from upstairs go like, "Mommy?"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He's wearing these baggy pajamas that drag just past the fingers, and he begins running down the stairs.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: That sounds right, that sounds right.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: No, it's the servant trying to catch up with him, and they both come down to join as Clara still isn't breaking eye contact and she just reaches out and takes your hand, and says, "It's good to see you."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Would you like to stay for dinner?" (Jester humming)

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: We are esteemed friends of your daughter.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, many friends "of Beauregard are friends of ours, so..."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Hey, Mom, remember that year we had that mud slide that ended up happening, and took out half of our stock, and we only had a few bottles left from that year?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Will you go grab one of those?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I've been talking about it a lot, you know, I'd love to--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Beauregard, this is Thoreau, Jr." (as TJ) "That is sister?" (as Clara) "Yes, it's your sister." And he walks up to you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he puts his arms around you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: He has that smell to him, like all the fucking kids in Kamordah.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Clara goes, "We were hoping you'd come by sometime, to meet him."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you know you were pregnant with him when you sent me away?

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Jester, would you help me over here for a moment, Nott, perhaps, everyone, if we could just.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he points at his mother's dress.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And he's just looking at you, going, and slobber coming off of it.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Well, it was a hell of a goodbye, you know? I'm not entirely sure why anyone would think that that was a good fucking idea to handle a situation with a daughter that was clearly, just wanting your fucking attention.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Things should've been handled differently, "you're right, you're absolutely right."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Did you get that bottle of wine?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Jeanine's--" and you hear the footsteps are coming from under the cellar.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Jeanine, Jeanine, Jeanine, Jeanine. Thank you, thank you.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: It's like a-- it's one of our most expensive bottles of wine, so enjoy.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I... was not expecting to see you today."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Ah, yeah, Mom, Dad, this is The Mighty Nein.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He looks towards all of you, and then looks to Nott, he goes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Why do you keep doing that?!

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Clara looks back, and picks up TJ, and puts him in her arms, and.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: By this point, TJ is looking right at Nott, after seeing, he's like, "Whoa!"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I am glad you've all been, "traveling, I assume."

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Just going to go and start rifling around for some cups or something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Still sending you those tuition updates, huh?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, it's important for us to, you know, "make sure we know how our Beauregard's doing."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I want to know if he seems like he's genuinely proud of her or if--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Go for it, make an insight check.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Travis is-- both of his fingers are in his nose right now.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The allergies are really bad right now.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: What do you mean, allergies? It's winter. There's no allergies.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: We all experience emotions in our own way.

lines.name: TRAVIS
lines.text: Late at night, my nose goes. I don't know what-- blame the internet.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: For this, I will try a sip.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I, "a toast to Expositor Beauregard Lionett."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I-- "I know you well enough, Beauregard, to assume you "haven't come for the sake of pleasantries."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Do you want us to stay?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I wouldn't be here if I didn't want something.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Listen, that story that you love to tell, at every family gathering, and for bedtime, and any chance you had, that old hag that you talked about, we need to find her.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Is that story even real, or was that just meant to terrify me?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: But I thought a dad was supposed to stay by their kid when they're having a fucking hard time.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe it's easy to justify the easy way out, just get rid of the problem.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I regret choices I've made, "and you don't think I don't hold myself responsible for-- "I thought I was doing what was best for you, truly."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Tell me the story again, and then I'll go.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You're trying to actually go to her?"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Um-- We think she has something to do with why--

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Your daughter's trying to do what she always does, help a friend.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, I mean, I've just heard the stories "growing up about the witch in the mountains."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Right when I began to think it was all a lie, "and I had thrown myself to the wolves for nothing, "there she was, with her crooked smile, "and hungry eyes, and--"

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So if you intend to actually go and see this witch, "just be careful."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: For me? Or for you and yours?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Maybe I'm the one that's sent to humble you.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm sorry if we didn't show it properly."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: (chuckling) I don't know if I feel validated or vindicated or what.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "I'm a bit caught off-guard and unprepared."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm, like, seconds away from losing my shit.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: But I would just encourage to maybe, maybe listen to them the way you listened to us, with open ears.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: How much better would it feel if you could just be clean?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Bu I'm so good at holding grudges.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: I know, you're really good at it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Well, looking at the bottle, "it's an extremely rare one, that I would've preferred "to have kept in the cellar, "but it's a special occasion, so enjoy it."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: And I guess I'm just mildly disappointed to see that the same amount of work hasn't been done or at least even remotely attempted.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Make sure he doesn't choke on it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Hold on just a second," and he nervously runs past you, and heads off into one of the side chambers.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: You're doing great, you're doing amazing.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You've done a really good job, Beau.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We all are here with you.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Question, protection? He thinks that protects you?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I told you he was incredibly superstitious.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: It might've been protective, or really valuable, I don't know.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm curious if this is a guy who's had things blessed, cursed.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: How superstitious is he in this house, how fearful is he?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Well, Detect Good and Evil, all right.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I'm going to do a Detect Magic on top of it.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: He rushes back in, and in his hands, and you can see a different design, but there is another tighter jade necklace, different carvings, he rushes over and he goes, "This is your mother's, but just please, please, for me, "if you're going to do this. (sighs)"

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Always good to have an upgrade.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You don't sense anything on the list.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: Detect Magic, just for fun, too, for the room, for everything.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The necklace he's granting is not magical.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "It's rare that a child's damage at that age "and "behavior "doesn't reflect how I, "hmm, "misstepped in my parenting."

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "So I hope with the company you keep, "maybe you won't repeat the same mistakes I have, "by treating the people around you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll let you know how it goes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Are we staying, are we going--

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You see he like comes up alongside her, and she walks up to you, and hands TJ over to your father, and takes your hand, "I'm sorry things, "things are strained tonight, "but it's good to see you."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'll let you know how it goes.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: You want to give her an awkward hug or anything? You know she's going to face a pretty powerful being.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: Any landmarks to look out for?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "And if I recall, it's "pretty straight north from here."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Should we take horses there, or should we go on foot?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "You can take horses as far as you want, "but there'll be a point where you won't be able "to bring them with you."

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Maybe we should leave the horses here?

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: Oh, you care about horses just a little bit.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: "Welcome to the Lionett Estate, and "travel safe. We look forward to seeing you here again."

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I swipe another bottle of wine that they have on display on the way out.

lines.name: SAM
lines.text: (laughter) If I don't see anything on the way out, I'll just take the cup I was drinking.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: On the way out, there are these small, square windows off to each side of the entryway, and they have these little, decorative tables with nice velvet over them, and you can see there's a couple of art pieces there that are relatively easy to grab.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You glance down, and it's this beautiful jade rabbit sculpture.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: (laughter) I'm one of the last ones to walk out.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Thoreau approaches to close the door behind.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: You are very lucky to have her.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: If, for some reason, we end up killing this hag, will all of this go away?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: As you leave, he just stands there with the door open, watching you all walk away, those words still echoing through his ears before the door slowly (clicking).

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: The sun now set, the sky darkened beneath the storm clouds, as another distant flash of lightning brings the calming thunder to your ears, Yasha.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I cry a little bit, and then, just grab everybody, and huddle everybody in.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Hug, hug, hug, hug, hug, hug.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You all come in for a cold, rainy hug here in the mud, on the outskirts on the Lionett Estate, here in Kamordah, a union of support.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: And that's where we'll end tonight's episode.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Totally where you expected it to go, right?

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: This has all been a great fucking role play, man.

lines.name: LIAM
lines.text: Travis, Travis, when you were gone, was Fjord's stool solid or runnier, or?

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: I'm going to sleep so good.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Man, it's so weird playing your asshole dad.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: It's a very strange disassociation exercise.

lines.name: ASHLEY
lines.text: I am sweating, and was just stress eating.

lines.name: MARISHA
lines.text: The back of my neck is drenched.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: There are NPCs that are challenging and such, but, like, between your dad and Taryon's dad, those are two NPCs that have been the grossest to step into for different reasons.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: You left an impression! I'm just looking over here, I'm like--

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: I felt that there was something in that fire that was worth, I'm so glad, that was great.

lines.name: MATT
lines.text: Looks like treading into the Cyrios Mountains that are surrounding Mount Mentiri.

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: Oh, you guys remember when we first started, when we were like, witch hut, witch hut--

lines.name: LAURA
lines.text: We're going to a witch hut!

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: And we know, we're going to be prepared, we're going to have our stuff together.

lines.name: TALIESIN
lines.text: We're going to make some good choices.
